{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.21664v1", "title": "Quadratic counts of highly tangent lines to hypersurfaces", "summary": "We give two geometric interpretations for the local type of a line that is
highly tangent to a hypersurface in a single point. One interpretation is
phrased in terms of the Wronski map, while the other interpretation relates to
the fundamental forms of the hypersurface. These local types are the local
contributions of an quadratic form-valued Euler number that depends on a choice
of orientation.", "main_category": "math.AG", "categories": "math.AG", "published": "2025-04-30T14:07:25Z"}
